ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My conversational german definitely improved and my confidence with speaking in general.
I became less self-conscious about my spoken German. I also gained more knowledge about German media. Overall, I feel like my German skills improved quite a bit.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths- covers a lot of topics, engaging class discussion, etc. Weaknesses- sometimes it can be a little dry, but that mostly comes from lack of engagement with the course

I feel like we should have had more time to read Tschick, then we would all be able to read all of it and have a better understanding of the book's story. Also, having e-mail partners is not the best idea, because it's not only confusing, but also difficult if your partner does not reply timely. Other than that, I feel like the course was strong. Watching the news in the beginning of every class was also helpful to get things started every morning.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's a good way to improve your german, and the seminar style intimacy of the class makes it easier to talk and feel confident talking in class.

Yes, I would. I went into the course expecting it to be slightly boring. However, Patrick made the course enjoyable and I improved my skills in German by much more than I expected. Replying to e-mail partners was kind of annoying, especially since we were always confused about what to do in those e-mails, but other than that, I feel like the rest of the workload teaches you something, from reading to speaking or listening. In short, if you want to improve your German skills, I'd recommend this course.
